title.narrative: 7.1. SOCIAL PROTECTION

description.narrative: By the end of 2022, National social protection systems to address the needs of mostdisadvantaged children at federal and state levels including in emergency situation strengthened, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Access To Inclusive Social Protection (Covid), Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By the end of 2022, government at federal and state level has implemented NSPP and fiscal policies progressively achieving greater equality

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2022, National social protection systems to address the needs of mostdisadvantaged children at federal and statelevels including in emergency situation strengthened

description.narrative: UNICEF&39;s technical guidance and close liaison with the Government achieved the revision of the National Social Protection Policy (including developing a sectoral implementation strategy and a costed action plan). It focuses policies on Nigeria&39;s evolving context and enhances the shock-responsive component considering the COVID-19 pandemic. The National Social Safety Net Programme was strengthened to ensure age-disaggregated data in the NSR and more inclusion and coverage of children. UNICE-led cash transfer programmes also expanded coverage targeting 2,000 women for cash and health insurance under the SDG Joint Programme. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:22/12/2021
